SSC192.name: Environmental Issues Seminar
SSC192.description: Environmental issues and problems explored from a variety of perspectives, including legal, scientific, historical, political, socio-economic, and technical points of view.
SSC192.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or in the College of Engineering or in the College of Natural Science or in the College of Social Science. Approval of college.

SSC199.name: Community Engagement: Act Locally, Think Globally
SSC199.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC199.description: Methods and concepts from social and behavioral sciences applied to improve active community engagement. Field experiences.
SSC199.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores in the College of Social Science.

SSC290.name: Selected Topics in Social Science
SSC290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC290.description: Topics may cover contemporary, theoretical, or applied issues or interdisciplinary approaches.

SSC292.name: Applications in Environmental Studies
SSC292.description: Community engagement project. Projects vary depending on student's major and area of environmental interest.
SSC292.restrictions: Open to students in the Environmental Studies Specialization.

SSC293.name: Introduction to Asian Pacific American Studies
SSC293.description: Issues that define the study of Asian Pacific American communities, including Asian Pacific American history, immigration, psychology, literature, family, women's issues, activism politics, and community.

SSC299.name: Integration of Social Science Perspectives
SSC299.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC299.description: Multidisciplinary study. Integration of social science perspectives and policy issues.
SSC299.prerequisite: (ANP 201 or ANP 203 or ANP 206 or EC 201 or EC 202 or GEO 151 or GEO 204 or HST 110 or HST 140 or HST 150) or (PLS 140 or PLS 160 or PLS 200 or PSY 101 or SOC 100 or SOC 161 or UP 100)
SSC299.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Global and International Studies in Social Science Major or in the Interdisciplinary Studies in Social Science Major.

SSC390.name: Disease in Society: Introduction to Epidemiology and Public Health
SSC390.description: Human epidemiology and population health issues facing contemporary society. Developed and less-developed settings. Health-related information in the mass media and scholarly publications.

SSC399.name: Service Learning and Civic Engagement: Theory and Practice
SSC399.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC399.description: Civic engagement practices and theories. Impact of non-profit organizations, practices of engaged citizenship. Volunteer placements at civic organizations.

SSC442.name: Social Science Data Analytics Applications
SSC442.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SSC442.description: Application of computational tools for data collection and visualization to various topics in social science research.

SSC490.name: Special Topics in Social Science
SSC490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC490.description: Topics may cover contemporary, theoretical, or applied issues or interdisciplinary approaches.
SSC490.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

SSC493.name: Social Science Internship
SSC493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC493.description: Methods and concepts from social and behavioral sciences applied in career-related settings.
SSC493.restrictions: Open to seniors or juniors. Approval of college.

SSC493A.name: Social Science International Internship
SSC493A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC493A.description: Supervised international field experience in social science.
SSC493A.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of college.

SSC494.name: Undergraduate Research in Social Science
SSC494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC494.description: Faculty-guided undergraduate research in the social sciences
SSC494.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Social Science or approval of college; application required.

SSC496.name: Field Study Abroad
SSC496.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC496.description: Study abroad under MSU faculty supervision. Social behavior and processes in selected countries.
SSC496.restrictions: Open to seniors. Approval of college.

SSC497.name: Flint Community Internship
SSC497.description: Methods and concepts identifying community assets in Flint

SSC498.name: Innovate Gov Internship
SSC498.description: Methods and concepts to provide critical capacity in Detroit
SSC498.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of college; application required.

SSC499.name: Capstone in Interdisciplinary Studies in Social Science (W)
SSC499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC499.description: Integration and application of interdisciplinary methods, models and theories in social science.
SSC499.prerequisite: (SSC 299) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
SSC499.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Interdisciplinary Studies in Social Science Major or in the Interdisciplinary Studies in Social Science Major or in the Global and International Studies in Social Science Major or approval of college.

SSC820.name: Proseminar in Food and Agricultural Standards
SSC820.description: Interdisciplinary theoretical and applied perspectives on societal roles and implications of standards in food and agriculture.

SSC826.name: International Development: Theory and Practice
SSC826.description: Evolution of international development theory across disciplines. Changing conceptualizations, measurements, processes and effects of development and poverty. Ethnicity, social class, gender, and community influences on socioeconomic processes. Current issues, concerns, and strategic alternatives.

SSC890.name: Special Topics in Social Science
SSC890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SSC890.description: Topics may cover contemporary, theoretical, or applied issues or interdisciplinary approaches.

SSC891.name: Food and Agricultural Standards Seminar
SSC891.description: Integration of multidisciplinary perspectives on Food and Agricultural Standards.
